required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Safety and Efficacy of Bepotastine Besilate Ophthalmic Solution in Seasonal Allergic Conjunctivitis Patients

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to study the safety and efficacy of bepotastine besilate ophthalmic solution in allergic conjunctivitis patients.

primary_outcome.measure: Rhinoconjunctivitis Quality of Life Questionnaire (RQLQ) - Mean Change in Total Score
primary_outcome.description: Responses to questions relating to symptoms and daily activities in the RQLQ were provided for 28 questions encompassing the 7 major domains of activities, sleep, non-nose/eye symptoms, practical problems, nasal symptoms, eye symptoms, and emotional state. Each response to an RQLQ question was provided on a scale of 0-6 units, where 0 = not troubled/none of the time and 6 = extremely troubled/all of the time. The minimum total score was 0 units and the maximum total score was 42 units, with higher score indicating decreased quality of life due to rhinoconjunctivitis.

secondary_outcome.measure: Mean Change From Baseline for Twice Daily (BID) Averaged Reflective Ocular Itching Scores Over the Treatment Period
secondary_outcome.description: Ocular itching was graded on a 4-point scale (0-3 units; 0=Absent, 1=Mild, 2=Moderate, 3=Severe) twice daily in the Screening Diary (Day -7 to Day -1) and the Subject Diary (Day 0 prior to first dose through Day 13).

secondary_outcome.measure: Mean Change From Baseline for Twice Daily (BID) Averaged Instantaneous Ocular Redness Scores Over the Treatment Period
secondary_outcome.description: Ocular redness each was graded on a 4-point scale (0-3 units; 0=Absent, 1=Mild, 2=Moderate, 3=Severe) twice daily in the Screening Diary (Day -7 to Day -1) and the Subject Diary (Day 0 prior to first dose through Day 13).

secondary_outcome.measure: Mean Change From Baseline for Twice Daily (BID) Averaged Proportion of Tearing Episodes Over the Treatment Period
secondary_outcome.description: Individual nasal symptoms and ocular itching and redness each were graded on a 4-point scale (0-3 units; 0=Absent, 1=Mild, 2=Moderate, 3=Severe) BID in the Screening Diary (Day -7 to Day -1) and BID in the Subject Diary (Day 0 prior to first dose through Day 13). Tearing was scored from Day 0 as either absent or present at the same time as nasal and other ocular symptoms were graded. The proportion of participants was calculated and then then average of the proportions.

secondary_outcome.measure: Mean Change From Baseline for Twice Daily (BID) Averaged Reflective Total Nasal Symptom Scores Over the Treatment Period
secondary_outcome.description: Individual nasal symptoms of rhinorrhea, nasal congestion, nasal itching, and sneezing each were each graded on a 4-point scale (0-3 units; 0=Absent, 1=Mild, 2=Moderate, 3=Severe) twice daily in the Screening Diary (Day -7 to Day -1) and the Subject Diary (Day 0 prior to first dose through Day 13). The minimum Total Nasal Symptom Score (TNSS) was 0 units and the maximum TNSS corresponding to multiple individual nasal symptoms scored as severe was 12 units

secondary_outcome.measure: Global Therapeutic Response Rating - Participant Assessed
secondary_outcome.description: Participants were asked if they felt that they had experienced improvement in allergy symptoms after therapy. Participant assessed global therapeutic response rating: categories that the participant could select were 'no change', 'slight improvement', 'improved', or 'marked improvement'.

secondary_outcome.measure: Global Therapeutic Response Rating - Investigator Assessed
secondary_outcome.description: Investigators were asked if they felt that the participant had experienced improvement in allergy symptoms after therapy. Investigator assessed global therapeutic response rating: categories that the investigator could select were 'no change', 'slight improvement', 'improved', or 'marked improvement'.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Subjects 12 years of age and older with 2-year history of allergic conjunctivitis
Exclusion Criteria:
- No active ocular or nasal infection

group.title: Placebo
group.description: placebo comparator ophthalmic solution: sterile ophthalmic solution administered twice a day

group.title: Bepotastine Besilate Ophthalmic Solution
group.description: bepotastine besilate ophthalmic solution: sterile ophthalmic solution administered twice a day

group.title: Placebo
group.description: placebo comparator ophthalmic solution: sterile ophthalmic solution administered twice a day

group.title: Bepotastine Besilate Ophthalmic Solution
group.description: bepotastine besilate ophthalmic solution: sterile ophthalmic solution administered twice a day

group.title: Total
group.description: Total of all reporting groups

outcome.title: Rhinoconjunctivitis Quality of Life Questionnaire (RQLQ) - Mean Change in Total Score
outcome.description: Responses to questions relating to symptoms and daily activities in the RQLQ were provided for 28 questions encompassing the 7 major domains of activities, sleep, non-nose/eye symptoms, practical problems, nasal symptoms, eye symptoms, and emotional state. Each response to an RQLQ question was provided on a scale of 0-6 units, where 0 = not troubled/none of the time and 6 = extremely troubled/all of the time. The minimum total score was 0 units and the maximum total score was 42 units, with higher score indicating decreased quality of life due to rhinoconjunctivitis.
outcome.population: The per protocol population included randomized participants with no major protocol violations, who had at least 80% dosing compliance during the 2-week dosing period and at least 85% compliance in providing nasal and ocular symptom grades in the Subject Diary, and who completed the RQLQ at Day 0 and Day 14 (+2).

reported_events.desc: The analysis population for the adverse events was randomized participants who received at least one dose of study treatment.

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
